definition: scapegoat
to take the blame for sb else/to compensate for one's crime/to get charges dropped (by paying money etc)
(slang) (neologism derived from 背黑鍋|背黑锅[bei1 hei1 guo1]) to carry the can/to be a scapegoat
scapegoat/sacrificial lamb/same as 替罪羊
to use (sb) as a tool
to make a mess of sth
to exculpate/to absolve/to exonerate
scapegoat/fall guy
to take the blame/to be a scapegoat/to carry the can
to cancel out a crime/to receive punishment as a scapegoat
to frame sb (by planting sth on them)
to use public office to avenge private wrongs
lit. to strike with a muckrake (idiom), cf Pigsy 豬八戒|猪八戒 in Journey to the West 西遊記|西游记; fig. to counterattack/to make bogus accusations (against one's victim)
to intercede/to plead for sb else
to throw stones at sb who fell down a well (idiom); to hit a person who is down
lit. to settle accounts after autumn/settle scores at an opportune moment (idiom)
